28 namespace DepthSense {

30  namespace Utils {

32  namespace Threading {
33 
35  // Mutual exclusion lock (non recursive)
37  class MutexData; // platform-specific
38  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API Mutex {
39  friend class Condition;
40  public:
41  Mutex();
42  ~Mutex();
43  void acquire();
44  void release();
45  private:
46  MutexData *_pData;
47  Mutex(const Mutex &);
48  Mutex &operator=(const Mutex &);
49  };
50 
51 
53  // Mutual exclusion lock (recursive)
55  class RecursiveMutexData; // platform-specific
56  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API RecursiveMutex {
57  friend class Condition;
58  public:
59  RecursiveMutex();
60  ~RecursiveMutex();
61  void acquire();
62  void release();
63  private:
64  RecursiveMutexData *_pData;
65  RecursiveMutex(const RecursiveMutex &);
66  RecursiveMutex &operator=(const RecursiveMutex &);
67  };
68 
69 
71  // AutoLock is a safe way of locking a Mutex. If the AutoLock
72  // object goes out of scope or is deleted, the lock is released.
74  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API AutoLock {
75  public:
76  AutoLock(Mutex &mutex);
77  ~AutoLock();
78  private:
79  Mutex &_mutex;
80  AutoLock(const AutoLock &);
81  AutoLock &operator=(const AutoLock &);
82  };
83 
84 
86  // RecursiveAutoLock is a safe way of locking a RecursiveMutex. If the RecursiveAutoLock
87  // object goes out of scope or is deleted, the lock is released.
89  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API RecursiveAutoLock {
90  public:
91  RecursiveAutoLock(RecursiveMutex &mutex);
92  ~RecursiveAutoLock();
93  private:
94  RecursiveMutex &_mutex;
95  RecursiveAutoLock(const RecursiveAutoLock &);
96  RecursiveAutoLock &operator=(const RecursiveAutoLock &);
97  };
98 
99 
101  // Signal
103  class SignalData; // platform-specific
104  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API Signal {
105  public:
106  Signal();
107  ~Signal();
108  void set();
109  void wait(); // Waits for signal to become set, resets it and returns
110  int timedWait(unsigned long timeout); // Waits up to the specified time for signal to become set, resets it and returns either success (0) or timeout (-1)
111  bool isSet(); // non-blocking version of Wait()
112  private:
113  SignalData *_pData;
114  Signal(const Signal &);
115  Signal &operator=(const Signal &);
116  };
117 
118 
120  // Condition
122  class ConditionData; // platform-specific
123  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API Condition {
124  public:
125  Condition(Mutex *mutex);
126  Condition(RecursiveMutex *mutex);
127  ~Condition();
128  void wait(); // Waits for the condition to be signalled and returns with the Mutex acquired
129  int timedWait(unsigned long timeout); // Waits up to the specified time for the condition to be signalled and returns either success (0) or timeout (-1) with the Mutex acquired
130  void notify(bool doLock = true); // Signals one of the waiting threads that the condition is met
131  void notifyAll(); // Signals all waiting threads that the condition is met
132  void lock(); // acquire the built-in mutex
133  void unlock(); // release the built-in mutex
134  private:
135  ConditionData *_pData;
136  Condition(const Condition &);
137  Condition &operator=(const Condition &);
138  };
139 
140 
142  // ThreadBase
144  typedef enum {
145  Initializing, Running, Suspended, Finished
146  } ThreadState;
147  typedef void (*ThreadMainFunc)(void*);
148  class ThreadBaseData; // platform-specific
149  class DEPTHSENSE_LIB_PLUGIN_API ThreadBase {
150  friend class ThreadBaseData;
151  public:
152  ThreadBase(ThreadMainFunc run, void *args, bool suspended = false);
153  ~ThreadBase();
154  void resume(); // Trying to resume a thread that's already running will have no effect
155  void join();
156  void setDebuggerThreadName(const char* threadName);
157  ThreadState getState() const;
158  static void suspend();
159  static void sleep(unsigned long ms);
160  static unsigned long getCurrentThreadId();
161  private:
162  ThreadMainFunc _pMainFunc; // the thread's main function
163  void *_pArguments; // arguments to this function
164  bool _createSuspended; // does the constructor create a suspended or a running thread?
165  ThreadState _state;
166  ThreadBaseData *_pData;
167  ThreadBase(const ThreadBase &);
168  ThreadBase &operator=(const ThreadBase &);
169  };
170  }
171  }
172 }
